billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO HOUSING, CONSTRUCTION AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT

title: Establishes tenant's rights to repair habitability-impairing conditions and receive offset cost against rent payments under certain conditions
summary: Allows tenants in multiple dwellings and multiple residences to offset against rent the cost of repairing habitability-impairing conditions in such dwelling or residence; establishes conditions and procedures therefor.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the multiple residence law and the multiple dwelling
         law, in relation to the correction  of  habitability-impairing  condi-
         tions by the tenant

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The multiple residence law  is  amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  section 305-b to read as follows:
    3    S 305-B. RIGHT OF TENANT TO OFFSET PAYMENTS FOR HABITABILITY-IMPAIRING
    4  CONDITIONS;  CERTAIN  CASES. 1. ANY TENANT ACTING ALONE OR TOGETHER WITH
    5  OTHER TENANTS OF A MULTIPLE DWELLING WHEREIN THERE EXISTS  ONE  OR  MORE
    6  HABITABILITY-IMPAIRING CONDITIONS DUE TO THE OWNER'S FAILURE TO MAINTAIN
    7  THE  PREMISES, MAY CONTRACT AND PAY FOR THE CORRECTION OF SUCH CONDITION
    8  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION. ANY PAYMENT  SO  MADE
    9  SHALL  BE  DEDUCTIBLE  FROM RENT PROVIDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISIONS HAVE
   10  BEEN SUBSTANTIALLY COMPLIED WITH BY THE TENANT OR SOMEONE ACTING ON  HIS
   11  OR HER BEHALF:
   12    A.  THE  LANDLORD  OR  HIS  OR HER AGENT WAS GIVEN AT LEAST SEVEN DAYS
   13  WRITTEN NOTICE THAT ACTION WOULD BE TAKEN UNDER THIS SECTION IF  CORREC-
   14  TIVE MEASURES WERE NOT RENDERED.
   15    B.  REASONABLE EFFORTS WERE MADE TO HAVE THE CONDITION REMEDIED BY THE
   16  LANDLORD'S USUAL TRADESMAN, IF KNOWN TO THE TENANT.
   17    C. REPAIR OF THE CONDITION WAS MADE BY A TRADESMAN  REGULARLY  ENGAGED
   18  IN THE APPROPRIATE TRADE AT A REASONABLE PRICE.
   19    D.  THE CONTRACTOR PROVIDED A WRITTEN STATEMENT CONTAINING THE FOLLOW-
   20  ING:
   21    (1) THE NAME OF THE PERSON OR PERSONS WHO REQUESTED THE SERVICES; AND
   22    (2) THE DATE, TIME OF AND PREMISES AT WHICH REPAIRS WERE MADE; AND

    1    (3) THE COST OF LABOR AND MATERIALS; AND
    2    (4) A CERTIFICATION THAT THE SERVICES WERE NECESSARY; AND
    3    (5) THE AMOUNTS AND FROM WHOM ANY PAYMENTS WERE RECEIVED.
    4    E.  AFTER RENDITION OF SERVICES, THE LANDLORD WAS SENT BY THE TENANT A
    5  COPY OF THE BILL FROM THE CONTRACTOR AND A STATEMENT OF THE  AMOUNTS  TO
    6  BE DEDUCTED FROM THE TENANT'S OR TENANTS' RENT FOR THE MONTH.
    7    F.  A  TENANT  SHALL  NOT BE REQUIRED TO COMPLY WITH THE PROVISIONS OF
    8  PARAGRAPH A OR B OF THIS SUBDIVISION UNLESS THE OWNER  HAS  CONTINUOUSLY
    9  KEPT  POSTED  IN A CONSPICUOUS PLACE AT THE PREMISES A NOTICE CONTAINING
   10  HIS OR HER NAME, ADDRESS AND TELEPHONE NUMBER OR  THAT  OF  HIS  OR  HER
   11  AGENT AND THE NAME, ADDRESS AND TELEPHONE NUMBER OF THE SUPPLIER OF SUCH
   12  SERVICES TO THE PREMISES.
   13    2. THE DEPARTMENT CHARGED WITH THE ENFORCEMENT OF LAWS, ORDINANCES AND
   14  REGULATIONS IN RELATION TO MULTIPLE DWELLINGS SHALL:
   15    A.  MAINTAIN AND, TO THE EXTENT PRACTICABLE, UPDATE AT LEAST BI-WEEKLY
   16  AN INDEX REFLECTING THE RANGE OF APPLICABLE WAGE RATES OF SUCH  SERVICES
   17  WITHIN THE JURISDICTION OF THE DEPARTMENT DURING THE LAST TWO WEEK PERI-
   18  OD FOR WHICH STATISTICS ARE AVAILABLE;
   19    B. MAINTAIN AND KEEP CURRENT AND AVAILABLE A LIST OF CONTRACTORS WHICH
   20  HAVE  AGREED  TO  MAKE  SUCH REPAIRS IN THE CIRCUMSTANCES, AND TO RENDER
   21  SUCH ASSISTANCE AS IS OTHERWISE REQUIRED HEREBY  TO  ENABLE  TENANTS  TO
   22  OBTAIN THE BENEFITS, CONTEMPLATED BY THIS SECTION; AND
   23    C.  RECEIVE  AND  COMPILE  COMPLAINTS  FROM TENANTS WHO WERE UNABLE TO
   24  PERSUADE   THEIR   LANDLORDS   TO   TAKE   CORRECTIVE    MEASURES    FOR
   25  HABITABILITY-IMPAIRING CONDITIONS AND WERE THEREFORE FORCED TO RESORT TO
   26  THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.
   27    3. THE PAYMENT FOR SUCH SERVICES AT A  PRICE WITHIN THE RANGE OF PRIC-
   28  ES  PERMITTED BY PARAGRAPH C OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE
   29  CONCLUSIVELY PRESUMED TO HAVE BEEN A REASONABLE PRICE.
   30    4. THE INTRODUCTION INTO EVIDENCE IN ANY ACTION OR PROCEEDING  OF  ANY
   31  STATEMENT  RENDERED  IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF PARAGRAPH D OF
   32  SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE PRESUMPTIVE OF THE FACTS STATED
   33  THEREIN. SUFFICIENT FOUNDATION FOR THE ALLOWANCE INTO EVIDENCE  OF  SUCH
   34  STATEMENT  SHALL  CONSIST IN THE ORAL TESTIMONY OF ANY PERSON NAMED AS A
   35  PAYER OF ALL OR PART OF THE AMOUNT INDICATED THEREON RELATING THE  FACTS
   36  AND CIRCUMSTANCES IN WHICH THE STATEMENT WAS RENDERED.
   37    5. ANY TENANT WHO HAS IN GOOD FAITH SECURED AND PAID FOR SUCH SERVICES
   38  OTHERWISE IN CONFORMANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION AND AGAINST
   39  WHOM  AN  ACTION OR PROCEEDING TO RECOVER POSSESSION OF THE PREMISES FOR
   40  NONPAYMENT OF RENT OR ANY OTHER ACTION  OR  PROCEEDING  ATTRIBUTABLE  AT
   41  LEAST  IN  PART TO THE TENANT SEEKING OR TAKING A DEDUCTION FROM RENT AS
   42  ALLOWED BY THIS SECTION SHALL, IN ADDITION  TO  ANY  OTHER  AMOUNTS,  BE
   43  ENTITLED  TO  RECOVER  REASONABLE  COSTS  AND ATTORNEY'S FEES AGAINST AN
   44  OWNER BRINGING SUCH ACTION OR PROCEEDING.
   45    6. NO OWNER OR AGENT SHALL BE  ENTITLED  TO  RECOVER  ANY  AMOUNTS  IN
   46  DAMAGES  FROM ANY CONTRACTOR WHO ATTEMPTS IN GOOD FAITH AND ACTS REASON-
   47  ABLY TO CARRY OUT THE INTENDMENT OF THIS SECTION EXCEPT DAMAGES  ARISING
   48  OUT OF GROSS NEGLIGENCE.
   49    7.  THE  REMEDY  PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION SHALL NOT BE EXCLUSIVE AND A
   50  COURT MAY PROVIDE SUCH OTHER RELIEF AS MAY BE JUST  AND  PROPER  IN  THE
   51  CIRCUMSTANCES.  NOTHING  IN  THIS SECTION SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO LIMIT OR
   52  DENY ANY EXISTING CONSTITUTIONAL, STATUTORY,  ADMINISTRATIVE  OR  COMMON
   53  LAW  RIGHT  OF  A  TENANT  TO CONTRACT AND PAY FOR SUCH SERVICES FOR THE
   54  MULTIPLE DWELLING IN WHICH HE OR SHE RESIDES OR TO PAY FOR THE  COST  OF
   55  ANY  OTHER  GOODS  AND SERVICES FOR SUCH MULTIPLE DWELLING. THIS SECTION
   56  SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED TO PRECLUDE ANY DEFENSE, COUNTERCLAIM OR CAUSE OF

    3    8. ANY AGREEMENT BY A TENANT OF A DWELLING WAIVING OR MODIFYING HIS OR
    4  HER  RIGHTS  AS  SET  FORTH IN THIS SECTION SHALL BE VOID AS CONTRARY TO
